org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.core.work

Class SimpleQueueWorkManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.core.config.AbstractConfigurationElement
      • org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.core.work.SimpleQueueWorkManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, ConfigurationElement, WorkManager, org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.jmx.element.WorkManagerMXBean, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware, org.springframework.core.task.TaskExecutor

    public class SimpleQueueWorkManager
extends org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.core.config.AbstractConfigurationElement
implements WorkManager
    The SimpleQueueWorkManager is an in-memory implementation which does not support message priorities or persistence It uses two thread pools - namely the primary and secondary. The primary pool will not queue messages, but go up to its max pool size in creating threads as necessary to handle the load. Once the primary is full, tasks are delegated to the secondary. The secondary is expected to queue messages after its max size is reached. In normal operations where only one WorkManager (i.e. the default WorkManager) is being used, its not required to tune the primary and the secondary, unless a proper analysis has been performed against expected load.
